thread.title: 7 Things You Didn’t See During The 2017 Golden Globes
thread.title_full: 7 Things You Didn’t See During The 2017 Golden Globes

author: Ariane Lange
title: 7 Things You Didn’t See During The 2017 Golden Globes
text:
View this image ›
Ariane Lange / BuzzFeed It credits Jesus for writing the Bible? I don’t know!
ID: 10288146 2. The announcer who talked to the audience during commercial breaks had a voice full of desperation. View this image ›
HFPA / Via goldenglobes.com “Do NOT miss the opening; you’ll want to be in your seats!” he told the crowd before the show began. “Live television in just over two minutes. Please find your seats,” he begged. He would go on begging for quiet during every commercial break, at one point saying, “Please cooperate with us.” It was sad!
ID: 10288170 3. Apparently even the Hollywood elite love Barb from Stranger Things , because she got a huge round of applause when she appeared in the La La Land -saluting opening musical number to the show. View this image ›
NBC Where is Shannon Purser’s sitcom since we all love Barb so much?
ID: 10288177 4. Milo Ventimiglia and Justin Hartley were rarely out of each other’s sight. View this image ›
Valerie Macon / AFP / Getty Images The This Is Us co-stars seemed to be joined at the hip for much of the evening!
ID: 10288216 5. This is a bathroom selfie. Loading View on Instagram
Instagram: @busyphilipps At around 6:30 p.m., I entered the ladies’ restroom and saw Sarah Paulson and Busy Philipps taking a bathroom selfie together. A real “stars, they’re just like us, but with more Instagram followers and better props” moment.
ID: 10288184 6. When Matt Damon said “hello to everyone back at the bar,” it was because no one was sitting down and everyone was yelling. View this image ›
Handout / Getty Images It is a very loud room!
ID: 10288198 7. Meryl Streep is the only person Hollywood respects. View this image ›
Paul Drinkwater / NBCUniversal via Getty Images When Streep took to the stage at the Beverly Hilton Hotel to accept the Cecil B. DeMille Award and sharply criticize president-elect Donald Trump, the room went quiet, because apparently by that point in the night she was the only person important enough to listen to . Meryl Streep: killing it at everything including commanding a room full of drunk people.
ID: 10288208 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
 More News About Meryl Streep, Matt Damon, Eddie Redmayne
